title: The 12 youngest Emmy award nominees and winners of all time
text:
17-year-old Asante Blackk was one of the youngest actors to be nominated for an Emmy of all time.

He was nominated for outstanding supporting actor in a limited series or movie for Netflix's "When They See Us," but lost.

He joined 11 other actors who were nominated while they were 18 years old or younger.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Asante Blackk wasn't just the youngest Emmy nominee this year, he was one of the youngest of all time.

At only 17 years old, the star of Netflix's "When They See Us" was nominated for best supporting actor in a limited series or movie. He joined a small group of actors who are 18 years old or younger who have been nominated in the Emmys' 71-year history.

Black lost during Sunday's 71st Emmy awards, but his "When They See Us" costar, Jharrel Jerome, won the prize for best actor in a limited series. At 21 years old, Jerome just missed the cutoff for youngest winners ever.

Millie Bobby Brown, who is 15, has been nominated twice for her role as Eleven on the hit Netflix show "Stranger Things," but the series wasn't eligible this year.

It's rare for the Emmys to nominate young actors, despite the fact that so many child actors have gotten their start on the small screen throughout television history. There have only been 12 actors 18 years of age or younger nominated for an Emmy, and only two actors in that age group have won since the award show began in 1949.

Amanda Luz Henning Santiago contributed reporting on a previous version of this article.

Below are the youngest Emmy nominees and winners of all time:
description: 17-year-old Asante Blackk was nominated for a best supporting actor Emmy this year for Netflix's "When They See Us."
